jobs.title: Engineering Manager, Data (f/m/x)
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Join our Data team as an Engineering Manager.

What you will do:

Manage a Data Engineering team: You will lead and manage the data engineering team who is working with Scala and SQL. You will set smart goals with the team that balance long term effective delivery with quality and team engagement. You will be responsible for coaching, mentoring and developing the team as well as partnering with People & Culture team in managing talent life cycle from attraction to retention.
Delivery: You will be accountable for the team delivering value to the company and will work closely with our product team to ensure effective planning of new features whilst advocating for technical best practices to drive long term efficiency and continuity of service. You will be adaptive and agile in ensuring the team can deliver value when faced with challenges and/or conflict of priorities. You will participate in improving Engineering wide delivery process and governance in collaboration with the Product and Tech Leadership Team.
Engineering: You will be leading the architecture and design of high-volume streaming and batch processing pipelines, data-warehousing projects and machine-learning ecosystems by effectively leveraging your past experience, the expertise of your team and through close collaboration with the Principal Engineers. You will understand and assure a culture of engineering best practices, improved processes while maintaining a continual drive towards standardisation. You will be responsible for leading API and data governance best practice. You will assure policies of availability and consistency of data as per understood operational needs. You will keep abreast of industry trends and knowledge within the Data Engineering domain.

Why join us?

As part of our team, you will work in a highly motivated environment, with equal opportunities, flat hierarchies and short decision-making processes. You’ll have a lot of freedom to contribute your own ideas and implement them.

The interesting role of managing a talented Data Eng. team in an organisation where data is at its core;
The opportunity to drive business growth and truly having an impact on the business;
A dynamic industry where you handle new problems every day;
An environment where you are encouraged to research, explore and try new ways of approaching issues:
An open and dynamic culture that supports great work-life balance.

Requirements
About you:

You enjoy managing people and you have done it successfully before;
You enjoy coaching, mentoring and developing team and individual’s skills;
You have used in significant capacity multiple programming languages covering different paradigms;
You have successfully built and architected complex distributed systems and understand the design trade-offs of consistency, availability and partition ability and can adapt these to the field of data engineering and high-volume use-cases;
You can lead to the topic of engineering governance, e.g. API design, data governance, schema evolution;
You are a problem-solver that can enable team delivery;
You know how to facilitate discussions and communicate with different audiences/stakeholders;
You care about engineering quality and know how it can be achieved;
You can speak, write and express yourself in English – our company’s working language – in a professional context;
We are awaiting your application and looking forward to starting our journey together!

jobs.title: Senior Data Scientist (f/m/x)
jobs.description:
Join our Data tribe as a Senior Data Scientist!


What you will do:

Responsible for full development cycle of models from data collection, cleaning and feature engineering to prototyping and model selection to experimental evaluation to documentation and maintenance
Build statistical and machine learning models to identify online users who are likely to purchase travel products
Research and design advanced bidding and budget allocation strategies to improve the performance of our in-house bidder
Collaborate with data engineers to develop and improve our scalable streaming user profiling platform
Enjoy huge data volumes and fast feedback loops via our real-time system

As part of our team, you will work in a highly motivated environment, with equal opportunities, flat hierarchies and short decision-making processes. You’ll have a lot of freedom to contribute your own ideas and implement them. 


The opportunity to drive business growth and truly having an impact on the business
A fast-paced industry where you handle new problems every day 
An environment where you are encouraged to research, explore and try new ways of doing things
An open and dynamic culture that supports great work-life balance, while being part of Amadeus, the biggest travel tech company in the world



Who we are looking for:

You have strong statistics and data wrangling skills: experimental design, data transformation, machine learning, validation and evaluation
You have excellent interpersonal communication skills and are comfortable giving presentations
You care about the quality and correctness of your work
You are curious and like to communicate based on data and insights
You are able to think about the context and business impact of the problems you're solving
You are results-oriented and have a record of successfully delivering projects
You possess good programming skills (preferably Python), have experience working with machine learning frameworks and writing SQL queries, and are able to learn new technologies quickly

We are awaiting your application and looking forward to starting our journey together!

jobs.title: Mid-Senior Data Engineer (f/m/x)
jobs.descriptionHtml:
What you will do:

You'll be part of a team responsible for the design, development and maintenance of our data processing streaming pipelines in Google Cloud Dataflow developed using Spark;
You'll work closely with the Data Scientists and Data Analysts, providing them with access to the data and support they need to analyse, train and deploy machine-learning models;
You'll own the full development and operations cycle of a product, whilst helping to ensure our systems are running correctly and efficiently;
You'll use industry-proven tools such as git, and practices such as CI/CD in an agile setup;
You'll be joining a cross-functional team. Aside from data engineers, our teams have Go Engineers, Data Scientists, Data Analysts, DevOps Engineers, and Frontend Engineers.

Why join us?

As part of our team, you will work in a highly motivated environment, with equal opportunities, flat hierarchies and short decision-making processes. You’ll have a lot of freedom to contribute your own ideas and implement them.

The opportunity to drive business growth and truly having an impact on the business;
A fast-paced industry where you handle new problems every day;
An environment where you are encouraged to research, explore and try new ways of doing things;
An open and dynamic culture that supports great work-life balance, while being part of Amadeus, the biggest travel tech company in the world.

About you:

You love Scala – either as Scala developer or a Python/Java developer willing to self-learn a new language;
You have practical experience with one or more distributed data processing frameworks such as Spark, Apache Beam, Google Cloud Dataflow, Flink, Storm or similar;
You care deeply about software best practices and are dedicated to ensuring quality via testing, benchmarking and peer review;
You have experience of using a pub/sub or message queue technology such as Kafka;
You understand the theory behind different database technologies and data storage practices enough to make informed choices and match appropriate technologies to a given use-case;
You dedicate yourself to continue learning and improving and you enjoy helping others grow around you;
You’re eager to understand the business logic of the company and the meaning of the data they work with;
You can speak, write and express yourself in English – our company’s working language – in a professional context;
You feel at home collaborating in a workplace which is international, diverse, evolving and continually innovating.

We are awaiting your application and looking forward to starting our journey together!

jobs.title: AdOps Specialist / Campaign Manager (f/m/x)
jobs.description:
Job description
Join our AdOps team as an AdOps Specialist / Campaign Manager!

 

By joining us, you will be combining your passion for technology and have a direct impact on the lives of millions of travellers, while also helping travel audience in becoming the global leader in data-driven advertising for the entire travel industry.



What you will do:

You own the execution and optimisation of your advertising campaigns from start to finish
Traffic and QA advertising assets (Native / Display / RTB / Video / Social)
Monitor advertising campaign performance on a daily basis
Combine data analysis, client feedback and trends to configure, operate and optimise complex campaigns to meet client objectives
Clarify and troubleshoot technical problems with the delivery of advertising material
Supporting the roll-out of quality assurance initiatives across the team
Define, build and improve internal team processes (documentation, workflows, training)
Be an active driver to help define new features and enhancements which improve our platform – working closely with cross-functional teams such as Business Intelligence, Engineering and Product Management
Provide valuable feedback to clients about campaign performance, optimisation and campaign insights
 

 

Why join us?

As part of our team, you will work in a highly motivated environment, with equal opportunities, flat hierarchies and short decision-making processes. You’ll have a lot of freedom to contribute your own ideas and implement them.  

A dynamic industry where you handle new problems every day;
An environment where you are encouraged to research, explore and try new ways of doing things;
The opportunity to work with large amounts of data;
An open, dynamic and international culture that supports great work-life balance.
 

Requirements
About you:

You are a team player with a strong sense of responsibility
You have Ad Operations and ideally extensive Programmatic experience
You love data and you are able to analyse it to derive campaign optimisations
You thrive in a fast-paced start-up environment
You share our passion to serve our clients & help them achieve their KPIs
You are fluent in English, other languages are a plus.
 

We are eagerly awaiting your application and looking forward to starting our journey together!

jobs.title: Principal Engineer (f/m/x)
jobs.description:
Join our team as a Principal Engineer!

By joining us, you will be combining your passion for technology and have a direct impact on the lives of millions of travelers, while also helping travel audience in becoming the global leader in data-driven advertising for the entire travel industry.


What you will do: 

You will drive the architecture and design as well as implementation for all of our systems, including real-time backend systems and critical data pipelines.
You will support the evaluation of potential external partners and be driving integrations as a technical expert.
You will take ownership of the full development cycle while ensuring the systems are running correctly and efficiently.
You will work with different teams to drive critical technical projects and initiatives.
You will evangelise engineering best practices, improve processes and raising the engineer quality standards.
You will report directly to CTO and will support Engineering Mangers team with your expertise.
 


Why join us?

 As part of our team, you will work in a highly motivated environment, with equal opportunities, flat hierarchies and short decision-making processes. You’ll have a lot of freedom to contribute your own ideas and implement them.

The opportunity to drive business growth and truly having an impact on the business;
A dynamic industry where you handle new problems every single day;
An environment where you are encouraged to research, explore and try new ways of doing things;
An open and dynamic culture that supports great work-life balance.


About you: 

You constantly see problems through different trade-offs and consciously choose the approach that is the most suited for the current situation with information at hand. You keep the holistic picture in mind while making more localised decisions.
You have strong experience with different programming languages and paradigms (including strong expertise with JVM)
You have significant experience driving the design of internal and external APIs
You have a proven track record of designing complex systems and large-scale architecture
You are passionate about engineering best practices and are dedicated to ensuring quality via testing.
You are dedicated to learning and improving continually and enjoy helping others grow with you.
You have excellent verbal and written communication skills in English and enjoy working in a dynamic, international, and innovative environment.
 

We are awaiting your application and looking forward to starting our journey together!

jobs.title: (Senior) Product Manager (f/m/x) - Data Analytics
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Job description
As a part of Strategic Growth Businesses (SGB) unit of Amadeus, Travel Audience is the world’s leading data-driven travel advertising platform. The business unit harnesses the power of cutting edge machine learning practices to connect the leading performance-oriented advertisers with the biggest network of publishers, reaching millions of travellers. The strategy is to optimize advertising across the entire traveller journey, identify and create new audiences, and increase our partners reach, relevance and booking volumes.

We are searching for a problem-solver and proactive Product Manager to join our fast-growing and diverse team. By joining us, you will be combining your passion for technology and have a direct impact on the lives of millions of travellers while helping us become the global leader in data-driven advertising for the entire travel industry.

What will you do?

You will be responsible for the whole product development cycle of one of our products (concept, benchmark, process management and optimization);
You will define and implement the vision of the product while maintaining the roadmap;
You will manage various projects at the same time, conceptualizing the tools according to external clients and internal users’ needs, writing requirements and working closely with the business owners;
You will work closely with our IT teams managing, maintaining and prioritizing the product backlog with a focus on delivering solutions towards business goals and technical requirements;
You will track, analyze and understand the key market and industry developments in online advertising;
You will work closely with legal entities every time needed.
Why join us?

As part of the travel audience team, you work in a highly motivated environment with flat hierarchies and short decision-making processes. You have a lot of freedom to contribute your own ideas and to implement them. We offer you:

We are building our own technology, so do expect creative freedom;
A fast-paced industry where you handle new problems every day;
An environment where you are encouraged to research, explore and try new ways of doing things;
The opportunity to work with large amounts of data;
An open and dynamic culture that supports great work-life balance;
An exciting working environment where you can continue to learn, improve and grow.

Requirements
You are who we are looking for if:

You love Product and the Advertising world with all its potentialities;
You have vast knowledge in managing the development of Data Products;
If you have worked on an AdTech product development before, that’s definitely a plus!
If you have worked in a Travel product development before, that’s is also a plus!
You have a solid knowledge of being a product owner in an agile environment;
You base your product decisions on the analysis of the data;
You are comfortable in working with issue tracking ticket systems (Jira) and documentation systems (Confluence);
You are a great communicator with the ability to quickly build multiple relationships with different stakeholders;
You are a real team-player, contributing to an environment of collaboration;
You take initiative, driven, proactive, goal-oriented and a true problem-solver;
You can speak, write and express yourself in English – our company’s working language – in a professional context;
You feel at home collaborating in a workplace which is international, diverse, evolving and continually innovating.
We are awaiting your application and looking forward to starting our journey together!

jobs.title: Manager/Team Lead Data Analytics (f/m/x)
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Job description
As a part of Strategic Growth Businesses (SGB) unit of Amadeus, Travel Audience is the world’s leading data-driven travel advertising platform. The business unit harnesses the power of cutting edge machine learning practices to connect the leading performance-oriented advertisers with the biggest network of publishers, reaching millions of travellers. The strategy is to optimize advertising across the entire traveller journey, identify and create new audiences, and increase our partners reach, relevance and booking volumes.

We are looking for an experienced Manager for our Data Analytics team composed by Data and Business Analysts. You will lead a team in supporting this exciting digital marketing vision while working closely with Data Scientists and Engineers and Business stakeholders.

What you will do:

Manage a Data & Business Analytics team: A team performing a variety of functions, including data visualisation for self-service, internal and external customer reports, insights analysis and business analysis working with BigQuery, Tableau, Airflow and advanced SQL. You will set smart goals with the team that balance long term effective delivery with quality and team engagement. You will be responsible for coaching, mentoring and developing the team as well as partnering with the People & Culture team in managing talent life cycle from Attraction to Retention.
Delivery: You will be accountable for the team delivering value to the company and will work intimately with our product team and business stakeholders to ensure both the effective planning of new visualisation and reporting features and delivery of business insights, metrics and KPIs. You will advocate for technical best practices, data integrity and quality, whilst driving long term efficiency and continuity of service. You will participate in improving Engineering wide delivery process and governance as part of the Product and Tech Leadership Team.
Technical Expertise: You will perform deep analysis of business metrics on behalf of internal business stakeholders and develop and monitor business KPIs based on performance data. You will ensure the quality, stability and evolution of our reporting and visualisation tools with an emphasis on providing a self-service model to internal stakeholders and external clients. You will define, in collaboration with the data science and engineering teams, the standards for data modelling, consistency and availability and help ensure our systems are running correctly and efficiently. You will keep abreast of industry trends and knowledge within the Data Engineering domain and drive innovation in the team.

Why join us?

As part of our team, you will work in a highly motivated environment with flat hierarchies and short decision-making processes. You'll have a lot of freedom to contribute your own ideas, implement them and work with a modern tech stack. We offer you:

The interesting role of managing a talented Analytics team in an organisation where data is at its core;
The opportunity to drive business growth and truly having an impact on the business;
The opportunity to work with large amounts of data;
A dynamic industry where you handle new challenges every day;
An environment where you are encouraged to research, explore and try new ways of doing things;
An open and dynamic culture that supports great work-life balance.
Requirements
About you:

You will have solid all-round technical experience and proven expertise in at least one domain as data, insights or business analytics or data visualisation.

You can perform deep data analyses using SQL, Analytics tools such as Tableau or a language such as Python;

You have successfully led a team before and enjoy managing people;

You can mentor and coach, develop knowledge sharing initiatives and plan long-term personal/team development;

You have worked with data analytics and visualisation tools such as Tableau, Qlik etc. and can produce customer-facing reports that are intuitive to use yet feature-rich with a good understanding of customer requirements and with a view to promoting a self-service workflow to business stakeholders;

You can plan, prioritise and troubleshoot;

You are a great communicator and you can adapt your message to different stakeholders;

You can be strategic on how we will use our tools and enable your stakeholders

You have a holistic understanding of IT systems, Data warehousing and ETL pipelines;

You can work with the Data Engineer team in scoping new requirements for data storage, structure and quality;

You can drive innovation by updating yourself and applying best practices in the team’s work dynamics;

You can quickly understand the business domain, AdTech knowledge is a plus;

You can speak, write and express yourself in English in a professional context;

We are eagerly awaiting your application and looking forward to starting our journey together!

jobs.descriptionHtml:
Job description
As a part of Strategic Growth Businesses (SGB) unit of Amadeus, Travel Audience is the world’s leading data-driven travel advertising platform.
